preferences.location_preference: Virtual (Zoom) to accommodate teachers commuting from different schools

success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant finds an available slot on or near 2025-12-11 between 16:00-19:00 PT and updates the Fall Literacy Coaching Check-in meeting from 2025-12-09 accordingly via update_meeting, keeping all existing attendees and virtual location details.

task.objective: Reschedule the Fall Literacy Coaching Check-in meeting

injected_behaviors.instructions: Maya needs to reschedule a virtual literacy coaching check-in with several Portland public school teachers. The original date conflicts with a last-minute district-wide assessment training. She prefers to move it two days later in the late afternoon or early evening so teachers can join after school, and she wants to avoid Fridays because attendance is usually poor then. She’s okay with a slightly shorter meeting if that helps find a workable time.

existing_meeting.title: Fall Literacy Coaching Check-in
existing_meeting.location: Zoom - Portland Public Schools Literacy Team Room

persona.name: Maya Ellison
persona.occupation: Literacy Specialist and Adjunct Lecturer in Educational Psychology
persona.bio: Maya Ellison is a literacy specialist in the Portland public school system and teaches a night course on the psychology of reading at a local university. She’s endlessly fascinated by how people make meaning from text, from early decoding to nuanced literary interpretation, and she keeps a notebook of favorite lines from every book she finishes. On weekends, you’ll usually find her at small poetry readings, annotating a dog‑eared collection, or drafting reflective essays about how language shapes the way we think.
persona.writing_style: warm, articulate, reflective, conversational but grammatically polished, often references books or concepts briefly
sample_messages: Could you help me pull a few recent articles on eye-tracking studies in reading comprehension? I’m revising my lecture for next Tuesday and want to give the students something more current than last year’s set.

I just finished the novel you recommended and I’m still thinking about that last chapter—especially the way the narrator’s voice shifts. Can we grab coffee sometime this week so I can return it (and probably leave with three more)?
Yes, that time works for me. If you send the draft over beforehand, I’m happy to leave comments on clarity and tone so we can talk through them during the meeting.

messages.output_raw: I need to reschedule a meeting called “Fall Literacy Coaching Check-in.” Can you help me move it to a different time?
